title: Air Products to supply hydrogen to Pallas' Texas project
text:
Air Products to supply hydrogen to Pallas' Texas project 23 October 2015 
US-based industrial gas supplier Air Products has signed a long-term hydrogen supply agreement with Pallas Nitrogen's Texas project. 
Under the deal, Air Products will supply 44 million standard cubic feet per day of hydrogen from its Gulf Coast Pipeline (GCP) to Pallas. 
Air Products will start supplying hydrogen by next year, when Pallas begins ammonia production operations at its Texas plant. 
The plant will be located on land leased from Air Products at its established Pasadena, Texas industrial gas manufacturing location, 
"It is really a win-win for us and our customer, and illustrates our continuous improvement approach to optimise our capabilities and assets." 
GCP is considered to be one of the world's largest hydrogen plant and pipeline network systems, where customers can easily connect to the system. "We look forward to a long-term, mutually successful relationship for this plant and our future work with Air Products." 
Air Products officially dedicated its 600-mile long GCP in 2012. The line stretches from the Houston ship channel in Texas to New Orleans, Louisiana, and supplies over 1.4 billion feet of hydrogen every day, from over 21 hydrogen production facilities. 
Pallas chief executive officer Steve Dopuch said: "The strategic location and direct access to their Gulf Coast Pipeline affords us great confidence with respect to safe, reliable and economic delivery of hydrogen to the Pallas ammonia plant. 
"We look forward to a long-term, mutually successful relationship for this plant and our future work with Air Products." 
Pipelines offer a safe and reliable supply of hydrogen to the refinery and petrochemical industry throughout the world and apart from GCP, Air Products has other hydrogen pipelines in thw US, Canada, and the Netherlands. 
Hydrogen is used in ammonia production, petroleum refining processes and other activities.
